title: Communities Should Have a Say in Whether They Want Drones
sub_head: Uniform federal rules designed for the jet age may threaten the privacy of your neighborhood.
body:
The drone industry and the Federal Aviation Administration are pushing to increase greatly the number of drones flying in and above U.S. communities. The question is: Do Americans want them?
The FAA is moving toward allowing flights “beyond the visual line of sight” of the operator, which would open up the skies to drones for everything from package or food delivery to police patrols.
